• Assume full responsibility in establishing and maintaining Integrated Master Schedules (IMS) for multiyear DoD (Department of Defense) programs up to 3 billion in lifetime revenue in accordance with Earned Value Management Systems, which met DCMA (Defense Contract Management Agency) guidelines for government contracts. 
• Systematically develop actionable plans utilizing reverse planning, risk, and opportunity. 
• Formulate a master phasing schedule view to show both baseline and current outlook dates and distribute to the Integrated Product Teams (IPTs) and Cross Product Teams (CPTs) for their use.  
• Drive positive results in forecasting and monitoring performance of programs by overseeing earned value submissions. 
 
Project Management (Logistics) 
• Hold accountability in developing an executable plan and overseeing changing contractual commitments by summarizing any risks or opportunities to the program team. 
• Directly supervise program execution at the Material Consolidation Point (MCP) while serving as a primary contact person for the MCP activities. 
• Provide expert oversight in measuring progress and identifying any problems to the appropriate program team members to ensure that workable solutions would not affect a schedule.  
•	Handle and coordinate the movement of equipment from US facilities to international countries working with product leads, freight forwarder, as well as government regulation for more than $50M in product sales. 
 
Tool Deployment: 
• Provide direct assistance to all automation and development of existing tool suite as well as with all testing of enterprise tool suite while collaborating with the Enterprise Team and business tool subject matter experts. 
• Handle comprehensive change request support which included developing detailed mock-ups for finalized requirements. 
• Serve as a subject matter expert in conducting and completing tool suite training and deployment. Program Management IBM January 2007  –  June 2010  (3 years 6 months) Essex Junction, VT • Rendered expert oversight to trusted foundry semiconductor aerospace and defense customers totaling 75 million in development per year which included 7 million in hardware sales. 
• Executed various tasks which included coordinating schedule, team deliverables, resource assignments, risk management, change management, project status reports, meeting minutes, agendas, action items, problem resolution, and key milestones delivery for technology transfers and development.  
• Prepared customer requested quotes for semiconductor IP (Intellectual Property), ASIC (Application Specific Integrated Circuits), and technology offerings.  
• Displayed strong leadership skills in spearheading event planning and hosting annual 3-day workshop for more than 100 external customers associated to IBM Trusted Foundry Services. 
• Applied best strategic approaches in ensuring appropriate levels of quality, on time and within budget delivery, and project alignment with the program plan and program governance arrangements; guaranteed that there is efficient allocation of common resources and skills within the project portfolio. 
• Directly supervised third party contributions to the program; communications to all stakeholders; both dependencies and interfaces between projects, and risks to the program’s successful outcome. 
• Displayed strong leadership in initiating extra activities and other management interventions wherever gaps in the program were identified or issues arose. 
• Presented progress of the program at regular intervals to the program director. 
• Managed key hardware program integrating the contracting agent and three other third party entities.  
• Executed a production launch which enabled IBM Microelectronics’ first EAL5+ secure flow qualification 
• Spearheaded a key project that was largely a ‘services’ led engagement rather than hardware, which presented elements of contention associated with effective and executable solutions for the client. Device Model Engineer IBM January 2004  –  December 2006  (3 years) Essex Junction, VT • Regarded as an effective team leader for managing laboratory characterization techniques as well as for modeling enablement. 
• Provided keen attention to detail in establishing DC/AC electrical parametric models, mismatch models, and noise models semiconductor technologies failure analysis; solving problem and deep dive projects on product yield improvements. 
• Rendered exceptional support to all request/issues in 65nm technology enablement, including various tasks such as:  
o On-demand enablement provided for key customer product problem which was delaying the start of product ramp.  
o On the STI-mismatch/stress/simulation setup problem in Circuit/Device simulation support  
o Failure analysis; override support; and problem solving. 
• Thoroughly reviewed the temperature slope issues for semiconductor devices.  
• Played a leadership role in directing needed model fixes, such as edge cap fix in sram devices; floating body, body contacted gate current fix; and wrapper model mismatch fix. 
• Prepared team documentation (Wiki), which allowed new hires and peer engineers to learn, view, and comment on work flow without using meetings and/or repetitive person to person explanations. 
• Carried out responsibilities in maintaining all DC testing standards updated on Wiki lab web page. 
• Spearheaded modeling interaction for Lean manufacturing project while supporting the development of standard threshold voltage mismatch testing script that could be assisted by the laboratory and accepted by all modeling groups. 
• Demonstrated excellent skills in presenting device modeling package to external customer for technology transfer. 
• Instigated DC testing standards across all the modeling groups. 
• Successfully established compact models for MOSFETs for various semiconductor technologies from 180-nm to 32-nm to support internal and external customer products.
